name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1614040862 likes:: 453 IsReply:: false IsRetweet:: false text:: Clarifying the valuation of $CCIV -

1.6B Pro forma shares x $10 deal value = $16B market cap

$11.75B EV implies $4.25B net cash at close ($2.07B from $CCIV and $2.5B PIPE less fees)

PIPE is at $15 or 1.5x market cap at $10 a share ($16B)

Therefore PIPE is at $16B x 1.5 = $24B retweets:: 108 replies:: 54

name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1609533147 likes:: 31 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: Regular postings from my account ‚Äì daily top gainers/news, weekly SEC filing update, link to every new DA investor presentation/press release, and monthly target screens based on the investor presentations presented by management. retweets:: 1 replies:: 3
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1609533146 likes:: 33 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: Share ‚Äì Voting shareholder. Each share has a floor at NAV.
Warrant ‚Äì Terms vary by SPAC, the most common is that they convert 1 warrant to 1 share at a price of $11.5 and expire 5 years after merger date. Ratios can vary greatly by SPAC so refer to the prospectus. retweets:: 2 replies:: 3
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1609533146 likes:: 40 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: Key terms with SPACs
Unit ‚Äì A new SPAC IPO is in the form of a unit typically. This is denoted by a U on the end of a ticker. A unit consist of a share and a warrant (or fraction of one). The unit is broken out to the share and warrant 52 days after IPO typically. retweets:: 2 replies:: 4
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1609533146 likes:: 37 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: If a shareholder redeems, they vote to not hold through the merger + receive the cash value of their shares back. This feature creates a ‚Äúfloor‚Äù for a SPAC before the merger is complete. Poor deals face heavy redemptions and the target company receives less cash than expected. retweets:: 2 replies:: 2
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1609533146 likes:: 36 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: Merger date ‚Äì a date is set for a shareholder meeting to announce the results of the SPAC shareholder approval vote. Shareholders must vote to approve the deal or not by this date. The shareholder may also elect to redeem the net asset value (NAV) of the shares. retweets:: 1 replies:: 2
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1609533146 likes:: 64 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: The SPAC trades as a projection of the target company during this period. Each weekend, I update and pin to my profile the status of all SPACs with a DA and where they are in this SEC filing timeline. retweets:: 2 replies:: 1
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1609533145 likes:: 52 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: Definitive agreement (DA) ‚Äì deal officially inked. The SPAC begins filing paperwork with the SEC to have the merger approved to take the target company public. This process typically takes 4+ months after the DA is announced. retweets:: 1 replies:: 2
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1609533145 likes:: 47 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: The LOI/rumor stage does not always happen, most go straight to a definitive agreement. Rumors should only be considered to have value if from a trusted news source, internet rumblings are pure speculation. During this stage, a deal can still fall apart and not be signed. retweets:: 3 replies:: 1
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1609533145 likes:: 49 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: LOI/Rumor ‚Äì A letter of intent is announced publicly or Bloomberg/Reuters etc. breaks news of a rumor that a SPAC is close to a deal with a target. retweets:: 2 replies:: 1
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1609533145 likes:: 89 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: SPAC timelines consist of these stages:
IPO ‚Äì SPAC raises cash and begins trading as a unit. The cash is placed in Trust.
Searching phase ‚Äì After IPO, the SPAC management team looks for a company to merge with. This is typically 24 months but can be shorter depending on the SPAC retweets:: 6 replies:: 5

name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1606589445 likes:: 24 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: The SPAC asset class exploded in 2020 to over 100B as interest has increased from both institutional and retail investors. name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1606589445 likes:: 25 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: Share ‚Äì Voting shareholder. Each share has a floor at NAV.
Warrant ‚Äì Terms vary by SPAC, the most common is that they convert 1 warrant to 1 share at a price of 11.5 and is good for 5 years after merger date. Ratios can vary greatly by SPAC so refer to the prospectus. retweets:: 2 replies:: 3
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1606589445 likes:: 26 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: Key terms with SPACs
Unit ‚Äì A new SPAC IPO is in the form of a unit typically. This is denoted by a U on the end of a ticker. A unit consist of a share and a warrant (or fraction of one). The unit is broken out to the share and warrant 52 days after IPO typically. retweets:: 2 replies:: 1
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1606589445 likes:: 21 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: If a shareholder redeems, they vote to not hold through the merger + receive the cash value of their shares back. This feature creates a ‚Äúfloor‚Äù for a SPAC before the merger is complete. Poor deals face heavy redemptions and the target company receives less cash than expected. retweets:: 2 replies:: 1
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1606589444 likes:: 23 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: Merger date ‚Äì a date is set for a shareholder meeting to announce the results of the SPAC shareholder approval vote. Shareholders must vote to approve the deal or not before this date. The shareholder may also elect to redeem the net asset value (NAV) of the shares. retweets:: 2 replies:: 1
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1606589444 likes:: 35 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: The SPAC trades as a projection of the target company during this period. Each weekend, I update and pin to my profile the status of all SPACs with a DA and where they are in this SEC filing timeline. retweets:: 2 replies:: 1
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1606589444 likes:: 29 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: Definitive agreement (DA) ‚Äì deal officially inked. The SPAC begins filing paperwork with the SEC to have the merger approved to take the target company public. This process typically takes 3-4 months after the DA is announced. retweets:: 2 replies:: 1
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1606589444 likes:: 25 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: The LOI/rumor stage doesn't always happen, sometimes they go straight to a definitive agreement. Rumors should only be considered to have value if from a trusted news source, internet rumblings are pure speculation. During this stage, a deal can still fall apart and not be signed retweets:: 2 replies:: 1
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1606589443 likes:: 21 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: LOI/Rumor ‚Äì A letter of intent is announced publicly or Bloomberg/Reuters etc. breaks news of a rumor that a SPAC is close to a deal with a target. retweets:: 2 replies:: 1
name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1606589443 likes:: 38 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: SPAC timelines consist of these stages:
IPO ‚Äì A SPAC raises cash and begins trading as a unit. The cash is placed in Trust 
Searching ‚Äì After IPO, the SPAC management team looks for a company to merge with. This is typically 24 months but can be shorter depending on the SPAC retweets:: 4 replies:: 4

name:: DJohnson_CPA timestamp:: 1601610601 likes:: 89 IsReply:: false IsRetweet:: false text:: $SPAC Lesson regarding market caps that I see a lot of confusion (possibly deception) on.

If a SPAC is $400M and they purchase a $1B target, that means they own 40% of the target after merger.  It does NOT mean the SPAC goes up 2.5X from $400M to $1B market cap as some post. retweets:: 7 replies:: 14

name:: spacanpanman timestamp:: 1613448184 likes:: 8 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: It's a risky move, but sometimes when it's down to one buyer left, bankers will leak that two are in the final bidding round with the hope of getting the last buyer to cough up extra $ before entering exclusive negotiations.  And that's sellside banking 101. #spacs #SpacSquad retweets:: 0 replies:: 1
name:: spacanpanman timestamp:: 1613448184 likes:: 5 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: Bankers want to create the perception that it's a competitive process. The banker may tell buyers that many others (not by name) are interested hoping to push bids higher. The buyers may be skeptical of this as it may be the banker bluffing to get bids to go up. retweets:: 0 replies:: 1
name:: spacanpanman timestamp:: 1613448184 likes:: 1 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: What do I mean? An investment banker is engaged by a company to "shop" it to potential buyers. The buyers typically execute a reciprocal confidentiality agreement to access company information. This agreement also restricts the banker from saying which buyers are participating. retweets:: 0 replies:: 1

name:: spacanpanman timestamp:: 1610858582 likes:: 11 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: 4/ ‚Ä¶is voluntary for warrant holders. name:: spacanpanman timestamp:: 1610858581 likes:: 11 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: 3/ Before the introduction of this warrant redemption feature (referred to as "make-whole" redemption), if the stock traded below $18 the only way an issuer could reduce the warrant overhang was to make a tender offer for the warrants (like in $LFAC/Landsea), which of course‚Ä¶ retweets:: 1 replies:: 1
name:: spacanpanman timestamp:: 1610858581 likes:: 17 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: 2/ This new feature allows sponsors to redeem warrants if the stock is trading at/above $10, which differs from the standard requirement that a stock trade at/above $18 for 20 out of 30 consecutive trading days. This enables sponsors to eliminate warrant overhang more easily. retweets:: 1 replies:: 1

name:: SPACtrack timestamp:: 1607802125 likes:: 9 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: 6/ 

I imagine most are aware of the difference, but just wanted to inform any newbies who may buy into a SPAC at a premium based on these internet rumors believing they are valid.

Also, it was a good chance to point out why I don't use the word "rumor" in my lists. retweets:: 0 replies:: 1
name:: SPACtrack timestamp:: 1607802124 likes:: 6 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: 5/

Now, whether these "talks" are advanced or not is a different story. As we all know, with the proliferation of SPACs, you would be hard-pressed to find a halfway-decent company that has NOT been in some level of "talks" with a SPAC (or ten) at some point. retweets:: 0 replies:: 1
name:: SPACtrack timestamp:: 1607802124 likes:: 5 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: 4/

However, the "In Talks" parties are or have been in talks, not speculation... likely leaked by the SPAC, the merger target, or other parties involved in the deal, in order to drum up awareness. retweets:: 0 replies:: 1
name:: SPACtrack timestamp:: 1607802124 likes:: 5 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: 3/

A SPAC reported as "In Talks" by Bloomberg is much different than a Reddit post speculating that $QELL will merge w/ Proterra due to a Director also being a Proterra Director (don't get me wrong, the speculation on which company a SPAC will merge with is fun). retweets:: 1 replies:: 1
name:: SPACtrack timestamp:: 1607802124 likes:: 5 IsReply:: true IsRetweet:: false text:: 2/

by prominent business publications (usually Bloomberg, Reuters, WSJ), I label them as "In Talks", though these talks are commonly referred to as "rumors". retweets:: 0 replies:: 1
name:: SPACtrack timestamp:: 1607802123 likes:: 21 IsReply:: false IsRetweet:: false text:: 1/

Agree w/ @SpacGuru - and it's very important to make the distinction between an Internet rumor and a rumor from a prominent news source... That's why on the SPAC Track site and whenever I post about SPACs on Twitter that have been reported on as "in talks" retweets:: 0 replies:: 2

name:: doc_steve_brule timestamp:: 1611520766 likes:: 67 IsReply:: false IsRetweet:: false text:: Im always asked warrant or equity.... If an equity ticker is at $11 and a warrant is at $3 on merger news when the equity runs to $20 the warrant will be at ~ $6. The risk on these two are ~10% and ~66%. The reward is 82% and 100%.
